definitions.example: The farmers had to revolt against the government to get what they deserved.

definitions.definition: To cause to turn back; to roll or drive back; to put to flight.
To be disgusted, shocked, or grossly offended; hence, to feel nausea; used with at.
definitions.example: The stomach revolts at such food; his nature revolts at cruelty.

definitions.definition: To turn away; to abandon or reject something; specifically, to turn away, or shrink, with abhorrence.
Revolution (The action of the verb to revolt)

definitions.example: The most revolting smell was coming from the drains.
